trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration.

trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure slave plug-in with Jenkins Continuous Integration

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure slave plug-in for Jenkins to provision slave nodes on Azure when running distributed builds.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure slave plug-in for Jenkins to provision slave nodes on Azure when running distributed builds.

trans-unit.source: To install the Azure slave plug-in
trans-unit.target: To install the Azure slave plug-in

trans-unit.source: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.
trans-unit.target: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.

trans-unit.source: On the Manage Jenkins page, click Manage Plugins.
trans-unit.target: On the Manage Jenkins page, click Manage Plugins.

trans-unit.source: Click the Available tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Available tab.

trans-unit.source: In the filter field above the list of available plug-ins, type Azure to limit the list to relevant plug-ins.
trans-unit.target: In the filter field above the list of available plug-ins, type Azure to limit the list to relevant plug-ins.

trans-unit.source: If you opt to scroll through the list of available plug-ins, you will find the Azure slave plug-in under the Cluster Management and Distributed Build section.
trans-unit.target: If you opt to scroll through the list of available plug-ins, you will find the Azure slave plug-in under the Cluster Management and Distributed Build section.

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure Slave Plugin check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure Slave Plugin check box.

trans-unit.source: Click Install without restart or Download now and install after restart.
trans-unit.target: Click Install without restart or Download now and install after restart.

trans-unit.source: Now that the plug-in is installed, the next steps are to configure the plug-in with your Azure subscription profile and to create a template that will be used in creating the virtual machine for the slave node.
trans-unit.target: Now that the plug-in is installed, the next steps are to configure the plug-in with your Azure subscription profile and to create a template that will be used in creating the virtual machine for the slave node.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Azure slave plug-in with your subscription profile
trans-unit.target: To configure the Azure slave plug-in with your subscription profile

trans-unit.source: A subscription profile, also referred to as publish settings, is an XML file that contains secure credentials and some additional information you'll need to work with Azure in your development environment.
trans-unit.target: A subscription profile, also referred to as publish settings, is an XML file that contains secure credentials and some additional information you'll need to work with Azure in your development environment.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Azure slave plug-in, you need:
trans-unit.target: To configure the Azure slave plug-in, you need:

trans-unit.source: your subscription id
trans-unit.target: your subscription id

trans-unit.source: a management certificate for your subscription
trans-unit.target: a management certificate for your subscription

trans-unit.source: These can be found in your subscription profile.
trans-unit.target: These can be found in your subscription profile.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a copy of your subscription profile, you can download it from <link><linkText>the subscription site</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a copy of your subscription profile, you can download it from <link><linkText>the subscription site</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Below is an example of a subscription profile.
trans-unit.target: Below is an example of a subscription profile.

trans-unit.source: After you have your subscription profile, follow these steps to configure the Azure slave plug-in:
trans-unit.target: After you have your subscription profile, follow these steps to configure the Azure slave plug-in:

trans-unit.source: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.
trans-unit.target: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure System.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure System.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down the page to find the Cloud section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down the page to find the Cloud section.

trans-unit.source: Click Add new cloud > Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Click Add new cloud > Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>cloud section</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>cloud section</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will show the fields where you need to enter your subscription details.
trans-unit.target: This will show the fields where you need to enter your subscription details.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>subscription configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>subscription configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the subscription id and management certificate values from your subscription profile and paste them in the appropriate fields.
trans-unit.target: Copy the subscription id and management certificate values from your subscription profile and paste them in the appropriate fields.

trans-unit.source: When copying the subscription id and management certificate, do not include the quotes that enclose the values.
trans-unit.target: When copying the subscription id and management certificate, do not include the quotes that enclose the values.

trans-unit.source: Click Verify Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Verify Configuration.

trans-unit.source: When the configuration is verified to be correct, click Save.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration is verified to be correct, click Save.

trans-unit.source: To set up a virtual machine template for the Azure slave plug-in
trans-unit.target: To set up a virtual machine template for the Azure slave plug-in

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine template defines the parameters that the plug-in will use to create a slave node on Azure.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine template defines the parameters that the plug-in will use to create a slave node on Azure.

trans-unit.source: In the following steps, we'll create a template for an Ubuntu virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the following steps, we'll create a template for an Ubuntu virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.
trans-unit.target: In the Jenkins dashboard, click Manage Jenkins.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure System.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure System.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down the page to find the Cloud section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down the page to find the Cloud section.

trans-unit.source: In the Cloud section, find Add Azure Virtual Machine Template, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Cloud section, find Add Azure Virtual Machine Template, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>add vm template</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>add vm template</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will show the fields where you enter details about the template you are creating.
trans-unit.target: This will show the fields where you enter details about the template you are creating.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>blank general configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>blank general configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name box, enter an Azure cloud service name.
trans-unit.target: In the Name box, enter an Azure cloud service name.

trans-unit.source: If the name you entered refers to an existing cloud service, the virtual machine will be provisioned in that service.
trans-unit.target: If the name you entered refers to an existing cloud service, the virtual machine will be provisioned in that service.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, Azure will create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, Azure will create a new one.

trans-unit.source: In the Description box, enter text that describes the template you are creating.
trans-unit.target: In the Description box, enter text that describes the template you are creating.

trans-unit.source: This is only for your records and is not used in provisioning a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This is only for your records and is not used in provisioning a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The Labels box is used to identify the template you are creating and is subsequently used to reference the template when creating a Jenkins job.
trans-unit.target: The Labels box is used to identify the template you are creating and is subsequently used to reference the template when creating a Jenkins job.

trans-unit.source: For our purpose, enter linux in this box.
trans-unit.target: For our purpose, enter linux in this box.

trans-unit.source: In the Region list, click the region where the virtual machine will be created.
trans-unit.target: In the Region list, click the region where the virtual machine will be created.

trans-unit.source: In the Virtual Machine Size list, click the appropriate size.
trans-unit.target: In the Virtual Machine Size list, click the appropriate size.

trans-unit.source: In the Storage Account Name box, specify a storage account where the virtual machine will be created.
trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account Name box, specify a storage account where the virtual machine will be created.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it is in the same region as the cloud service you'll be using.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it is in the same region as the cloud service you'll be using.

trans-unit.source: If you want new storage to be created, you can leave this box blank.
trans-unit.target: If you want new storage to be created, you can leave this box blank.

trans-unit.source: Retention time specifies the number of minutes before Jenkins deletes an idle slave.
trans-unit.target: Retention time specifies the number of minutes before Jenkins deletes an idle slave.

trans-unit.source: Leave this at the default value of 60.
trans-unit.target: Leave this at the default value of 60.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose to shut down the slave instead of deleting it when it's idle.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose to shut down the slave instead of deleting it when it's idle.

trans-unit.source: To do that, select the Shutdown Only (Do Not Delete) After Retention Time check box.
trans-unit.target: To do that, select the Shutdown Only (Do Not Delete) After Retention Time check box.

trans-unit.source: In the Usage list, click the appropriate condition when this slave node will be used.
trans-unit.target: In the Usage list, click the appropriate condition when this slave node will be used.

trans-unit.source: For now, click Utilize this node as much as possible.
trans-unit.target: For now, click Utilize this node as much as possible.

trans-unit.source: At this point, your form should look somewhat similar to this:
trans-unit.target: At this point, your form should look somewhat similar to this:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>checkpoint general template config</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>checkpoint general template config</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The next step is to provide details about the operating system image that you want your slave to be created in.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to provide details about the operating system image that you want your slave to be created in.

trans-unit.source: In the Image Family or Id box, you have to specify what system image will be installed on your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the Image Family or Id box, you have to specify what system image will be installed on your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can either select from a list of image families or specify a custom image.
trans-unit.target: You can either select from a list of image families or specify a custom image.

trans-unit.source: If you want to select from a list of image families, enter the first character (case-sensitive) of the image family name.
trans-unit.target: If you want to select from a list of image families, enter the first character (case-sensitive) of the image family name.

trans-unit.source: For instance, typing U will bring up a list of Ubuntu Server families.
trans-unit.target: For instance, typing U will bring up a list of Ubuntu Server families.

trans-unit.source: After you select from the list, Jenkins will use the latest version of that system image from that family when provisioning your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: After you select from the list, Jenkins will use the latest version of that system image from that family when provisioning your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>OS Image list sample</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>OS Image list sample</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have a custom image that you want to use instead, enter the name of that custom image.
trans-unit.target: If you have a custom image that you want to use instead, enter the name of that custom image.

trans-unit.source: Custom image names are not shown in a list, so you have to ensure that the name is entered correctly.
trans-unit.target: Custom image names are not shown in a list, so you have to ensure that the name is entered correctly.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, type U to bring up a list of Ubuntu images, and then click Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, type U to bring up a list of Ubuntu images, and then click Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.

trans-unit.source: In the Launch Method list, click SSH.
trans-unit.target: In the Launch Method list, click SSH.

trans-unit.source: Copy the script below and paste it in the Init Script box.
trans-unit.target: Copy the script below and paste it in the Init Script box.

trans-unit.source: The init script will be executed after the virtual machine is created.
trans-unit.target: The init script will be executed after the virtual machine is created.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the script installs Java, Git, and ant.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the script installs Java, Git, and ant.

trans-unit.source: In the Username and Password boxes, enter your preferred values for the administrator account that will be created on your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the Username and Password boxes, enter your preferred values for the administrator account that will be created on your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click Verify Template to check if the parameters you specified are valid.
trans-unit.target: Click Verify Template to check if the parameters you specified are valid.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: To create a Jenkins job that runs on a slave node on Azure
trans-unit.target: To create a Jenkins job that runs on a slave node on Azure

trans-unit.source: In this section, you'll be creating a Jenkins task that will run on a slave node on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you'll be creating a Jenkins task that will run on a slave node on Azure.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to have your own project up on GitHub to follow along.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to have your own project up on GitHub to follow along.

trans-unit.source: In the Jenkins dashboard, click New Item.
trans-unit.target: In the Jenkins dashboard, click New Item.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the task you are creating.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the task you are creating.

trans-unit.source: For the project type, click Freestyle project.
trans-unit.target: For the project type, click Freestyle project.

trans-unit.source: Click Ok.
trans-unit.target: Click Ok.

trans-unit.source: In the task configuration page, select Restrict where this project can be run.
trans-unit.target: In the task configuration page, select Restrict where this project can be run.

trans-unit.source: In the Label Expression box, enter linux.
trans-unit.target: In the Label Expression box, enter linux.

trans-unit.source: In the previous section, we created a slave template that we named linux, which is what we're specifying here.
trans-unit.target: In the previous section, we created a slave template that we named linux, which is what we're specifying here.

trans-unit.source: In the Build section, click Add build step and select Execute shell.
trans-unit.target: In the Build section, click Add build step and select Execute shell.

trans-unit.source: Edit the following script, replacing (your GitHub account name), (your project name), and (your project directory) with appropriate values, and paste the edited script in the text area that appears.
trans-unit.target: Edit the following script, replacing (your GitHub account name), (your project name), and (your project directory) with appropriate values, and paste the edited script in the text area that appears.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: In the Jenkins dashboard, hover over the task you just created and click the drop-down arrow to display task options.
trans-unit.target: In the Jenkins dashboard, hover over the task you just created and click the drop-down arrow to display task options.

trans-unit.source: Click Build now.
trans-unit.target: Click Build now.

trans-unit.source: Jenkins will then create a slave node by using the template created in the previous section and execute the script you specified in the build step for this task.
trans-unit.target: Jenkins will then create a slave node by using the template created in the previous section and execute the script you specified in the build step for this task.
